title: South Africa: Durban Flight School's Fatal Crash
text:
South Africa: FlySafair to Extend Sale As 'R1' Promotion Crashes Website 
Durban Aviation Centre Chief Flight Instructor Jon Sargood confirmed that the plane belonged to the flight school, but would not comment further, saying they were still awaiting further information. 
A source with knowledge of the incident, who requested anonymity, said the aircraft had taken off from Virginia Airport and had been flying to the "general flying area" where student pilots practise. 
"We have checked with ATC [air traffic control] and their last call was as they crossed the Illovo River and as far as we know, it was their last communication," the source said. 
KZN EMS spokesperson Robert McKenzie said the wreckage was located in a sugarcane field. 
"It crashed about 20m away from the freeway and burst into flames and when emergency services put the fire out, the bodies were found," he said. 
WRECKAGE | Two people were killed in a light aircraft crash near Winklespruit, south of Durban, on Tuesday... 
Posted by News24.com on Tuesday, August 25, 2015 
Source: News24
